Beginner.description: Users with basic Python knowledge, no AI/ML experience.

topics.name: Python Basics
topics.study_method: Watch tutorials, read official Python docs, practice exercises daily.

topics.name: Mathematics for AI
topics.study_method: Follow online courses, solve example problems, apply concepts in Python.

Beginner.next_steps: Complete all topics and projects to move to Intermediate level: ML basics, simple DL, and project-based practice.

Intermediate.description: Users with Python proficiency ready for Machine Learning and Deep Learning fundamentals.

topics.name: Machine Learning Fundamentals
topics.study_method: Mix theory + hands-on exercises, implement algorithms from scratch and using libraries.

topics.name: Deep Learning Basics
topics.study_method: Follow tutorials, implement small neural networks, train on MNIST and other datasets.

topics.name: Intermediate Self-Practice
topics.study_method: Combine mini-projects and real datasets for hands-on experience.

Intermediate.next_steps: After mastering ML and DL fundamentals, move to Advanced level: CV, NLP, RL, and portfolio building.

Advanced.description: Users ready for specialization but may still want to consolidate skills.

topics.name: Computer Vision (CV)
topics.study_method: Work on real datasets, implement end-to-end projects, explore pretrained models.

topics.name: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
topics.study_method: Build models on text datasets, implement preprocessing pipelines, fine-tune transformers.

topics.name: Reinforcement Learning (RL) Basics
topics.study_method: Experiment with RL environments, implement basic agents, analyze performance.

topics.name: Advanced Practice & Portfolio Building
topics.study_method: Iterate on projects, deploy models, document work, continuously refine skills.

Advanced.next_steps: Keep iterating and improving skills, specialize in one subfield (CV/NLP/RL), build portfolio and real-world applications.
